segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation:
BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the order response by means of its number and when necessary its function.
- If the MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE is a "12", "27" or "29" indicating that the total message was not processed, rejected or accepted. No segments, other than mandatory segments, need be used in the message Header, Detail or Summary sections. However for positive reporting purposes all the segments of the ORDERS or ORDCHG message, being responded to, may be used in ORDRSP.
- If the MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE is a "28" indicating an accepted ORDERS or ORDCHG message with amended heading information or "34" indicating amendment in the message, then all segments in the heading section must be used from the ORDRES or ORDCHG message being responded to. This includes both amended and non amended segments.
If the ORDERS message was "NOT PROCESSED"; use of MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE "12" indicates acknowledgement that the transmitted message has been received and understood by the seller, but remains to be processed within his application system.
If the Order or Order Change message was "NOT ACCEPTED"; use of MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE "27" indicates that the seller declines to supply the goods or declines to accept the changes requested in a Purchase Order Change Request.
If the ORDER or ORDER CHANGE message was "ACCEPTED, WITH AMENDMENT IN HEADING SECTION"; use of MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE "28" indicates that the seller accepts to supply the goods or services requested in the Purchase Order (or a Purchase Order Change Request), but requires one or more changes to the terms set out in the referenced message Heading Section. The complete Heading Section data is transmitted to replace all data previously sent. The Detail Section is considered as acknowledged without change.
If the ORDER or ORDER CHANGE message was "ACCEPTED, WITHOUT AMENDMENT"; use of MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE "29" indicates that the seller according to the terms set out in the Purchase Order or a Purchase Order Change Request accepts to supply the goods or services requested or where appropriate accepts the cancellation.
If the ORDER or ORDER CHANGE message was "ACCEPTED, WITH AMENDMENT IN DETAIL SECTION"; use of MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE "30" indicates that the seller accepts to supply the goods or services requested in the Purchase Order (or a Purchase Order Change Request), but requires changes in one or more line items (as indicated in the LIN segments). The Heading Section is considered as acknowledged without change If the ORDER or ORDER CHANGE message was "ACCEPTED WITH AMENDMENT"; use of MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE "34" indicates that the seller accepts to supply the goods or services requested in the Purchase Order and Purchase Order Change Request, but requires changes in the Heading as well as Detail Section.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation:
DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the order response date.
Examples of the use of this DTM segment are: Lead times that apply to the whole of the Order response and, if no schedule is to be specified, the delivery date.
The Date/time/period segment within other Segment groups should be used whenever the date/time/period needs to be logically related to another specified data item. e.g. Payment due date is specified within the PYT Segment group.

segment.name: Payment instructions
segment.documentation: PAI, A segment requesting or confirming conditions of payment, guarantee and method of payment for the whole order response An example of the use of this segment is to specify that a documentary credit will be used.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating special conditions related to the total order response owing to origin, customs preference, or other commercial factors.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment providing a description common to all line items of the order response.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Related identification numbers
segment.documentation: GIR, A segment providing related identification numbers common to all line items.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments for giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message, e.g. contract number, import/export licence number, reservation number.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A segment group to give information about adjustment.

segment.name: Adjustment details
segment.documentation: AJT, A segment giving adjustment details.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment giving additional information on the adjustment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the order response. Identification of the seller and buyer parties is mandatory for the order response message. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified. e.g. The Buyer and Seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required, but the Consignee or Delivery address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment e.g. internal site/building number.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution (e.g. bank) and relevant account numbers for the seller, buyer and where necessary other parties. e.g. the buyer may provide a choice of financial institutions for direct debit purposes.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the whole order response.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying the documentary requirements of the specified party.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying and providing information relating to the documents required by the party specified by the NAD segment. For example, the party may require a Certificate of Analysis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time of the document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments specifying tax related information, and when necessary, the location(s) to which that tax information relates.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate, or exemption, relating to the whole order response. e.g. Value Added Tax at the standard rate is applicable for all items.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which the tax or exemption specified in the tax segment applies, e.g. city or state or country.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments specifying the currencies and related dates/periods valid for the whole order response. Currency data maybe omitted in national applications but will be required for international transactions.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies in the order response, e.g. the order currency. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the fluctuation beyond those limits will allow one or either party to re-negotiate prices.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments specifying the terms of payment applicable for the whole order response.

segment.name: Payment terms
segment.documentation: PYT, A segment identifying the payment terms and date/time basis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the specific date/time/period, if needed, of any payments, discounts, instalments etc.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the discount, interest, penalty as well as instalment percentage.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to payment discounts, penalties or instalments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the whole order response.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods. If required, the carrier's address should be indicated within the NAD Segment group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments giving the location and date/time information relative to the transportation.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport specified in the TDT segment. e.g. place of departure or border crossing point.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date/time details of departure and/or arrival of the transported goods for the specified location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the whole order response.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms to be used. e.g. UN INCOTERMS code could be used to specify the delivery terms.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms specified in the TOD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying the packaging, physical dimensions and marks and numbers for goods referenced by the whole order response.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of packages for the whole order response, e.g. number and type of pallets.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment. e.g. package length, weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments specifying the markings and labels on individual physical units.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the master label number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates relevant to the package markings.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment identifying the number or ranges of numbers for use with the package markings.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments providing information relating to equipment identification and ownership, handling and identification of hazardous materials, relating to the whole order response.

segment.name: Equipment details
segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to define information regarding equipment to be used in conjunction with the whole order, and if required, to indicate responsibility for supply of the equipment.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling of materials and additionally, if required, identifying hazardous materials.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment providing measurement information for the equipment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments specifying delivery schedules relating to quantities, frequencies, dates and references, for the whole order response.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, A segment specifying the type and status of the schedule being given, and optionally defining a pattern to be established, e.g. firm or proposed delivery schedule for a weekly pattern.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to give further clarification to scheduling instructions. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for specifying the reference for schedule.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments to specify the scheduled quantities, date/time of the schedule, and where required, the reference of the schedule.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities relating to the schedule and pattern established in the SCC segment, e.g. delivery quantity.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time details relating to the quantity and schedule used to indicate date/time ranges, e.g. start and end dates for a delivery pattern, or delivery window.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments providing information concerning pricing related to the type of trade, and, where appropriate, indication of quantities, dates/periods or amounts.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to identify additional pricing information such as a price multiplier, the class or type of trade and additionally identifying the reason for any changes.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to identify the date/time/period information related to the price change. e.g. period of validity.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify the quantity or amount ranges to which the additional price information applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the whole order response. The allowance or charge specified within this Segment group may either relate to the total order response in which case it cannot be overridden at detail level, or it can relate to the line items as a default allowance/charge and can be overridden by the allowance and charge segment group within the detail section. Where relevant, additional information, tax and alternate currency details are to be indicated in the tax and monetary amount segments. The basis for the calculation of the allowance/charge may be a quantity, a percentage, an amount or a rate and one of the appropriate subordinate segment group(s) should be used accordingly.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to identify the date/time/period information related to the allowance or charge, e.g. period of validity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified, e.g. an allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified, e.g. an allowance of 5000 BEF may be specified if goods value ordered is greater than 100000 BEF.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying monetary amounts for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the tax amount for the allowance or charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments identifying any rules, laws or regulations with which the supplier must comply to meet requirements. e.g. building regulations, safety requirements, etc.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to enable industry or national requirements to be specified.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and, where appropriate, a line number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time details relating to the references.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments that refers through an external file identification to each of the external files and giving additional information about each of the files.

segment.name: External file link identification
segment.documentation: EFI, This segment will identify the external files by indicating the file name, file number and its sequence number in an exchange.

segment.name: Computer environment details
segment.documentation: CED, To give precise definitions of all necessary elements belonging to the configuration of a computer system, e.g. hardware, firmware, operating system, communication and application software.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment giving reference related to the file identified by a previous external file link identification segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, This segment will convey the date/time details of the external file.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation:
QTY, The size/volume of the external file identified in the previous external file link identification segment. external file.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: QVR-DOC-PAI-MTD-FTX-SG28-SG29-SG30-SG31-SG32- SG33-SG36-SG38-SG39-SG44-SG50-SG52-SG53-SG54- SG56-SG57-SG59 A group of segments providing details of the individual ordered items. This Segment group may be repeated to give sub-line details.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation:
LIN, A segment identifying the line item by the line number and configuration level, and additionally, identifying the product or service ordered. Other product identification numbers, e.g. Buyer product number, etc., can be specified within the following PIA segment.
The following Semantic Note concern the use of D/E 1229 Action Request Code for segment group 26. If the MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE is "30" indicating that there is amended detail data or "34" indicating amendments in the message, only the "amended" or "referenced" LIN segments, and all their subordinate segments, need to be included in the detail section.
If the MESSAGE FUNCTION CODE is other than "30" or "34" there are no amendments to the detail section and the entire section is not required in the message. However for positive acknowledgement purposes, users may wish to resend the entire detail section of the ORDERS or ORDCHG message. The value of the ACTION REQUEST CODE in the included LIN segment will indicate the extent of amendment or reference use.
If the line item has not yet been processed and is not being formally acknowledged an ACTION REQUEST CODE "4" indicates "NO ACTION".
If the seller accepts to supply the line item an ACTION REQUEST CODE (D/E 1229) "5" indicates "ACCEPTED WITHOUT AMENDMENT".
If the seller accepts to supply the line item, but requires one or more amendments to the terms set out in the referenced message, as indicated by the data following the LIN segment. An ACTION REQUEST CODE "6" indicates "ACCEPTED WITH AMENDMENT".
If the seller declines to supply the line items in a Purchase Order, or in a Purchase Order Change Request an ACTION REQUEST CODE "7" indicates "NOT ACCEPTED".
If the seller indicates that a request for change on this line item cannot be processed as the referenced item cannot be located in his application system an ACTION REQUEST CODE "10" indicates "NOT FOUND".
If the line item has not changed in status and no action has been taken, and the item is transmitted for information purposes or positioning an ACTION REQUEST CODE "11" indicates "NOT AMENDED".

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing either additional identification to the product specified in the LIN segment (e.g. Harmonized System number), or provides any substitute product identification.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the product or service being ordered as well as product characteristic. This segment should be used for products or services that cannot be fully identified by a product code or article number.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment enabling the physical measurements of the ordered item to be specified where this is required for full identification of the product. Any measurements must refer to the product in its unpacked form. e.g. thickness of plastic film, length, weight, etc.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the product quantities e.g. ordered quantity.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the strength or yield of a product as a percentage, e.g. 80% to indicate the strength of an Acid.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, To indicate that special conditions due to the origin, customs preference, fiscal or commercial factors are applicable.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date/time/period details relating to the line item only.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying any monetary amounts relating to the product, e.g. item amount, insurance value, customs value.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment used to specify general processing information about the line item.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers to be applied to the goods being ordered, e.g. serial numbers for assembled equipment.

segment.name: Related identification numbers
segment.documentation: GIR, A segment providing sets of related identification numbers for a line item, e.g. engine numbers, chassis number and transmission number for a vehicle.

segment.name: Quantity variances
segment.documentation: QVR, A segment identifying order quantity variances, normally specified by the supplier using an Order Response message.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to indicate that a certificate/declaration of origin is required for the ordered article.

segment.name: Payment instructions
segment.documentation: PAI, A segment to indicate that where a central buyer is purchasing on behalf of different consignees, the means of payment may differ for each item/consignee combination as specified in segment group 25.

segment.name: Maintenance operation details
segment.documentation: MTD, A segment giving details of the maintenance on object relating to the item, such as tools and packages. The party that is responsible as well as who is paying, can also be given.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments providing product characteristic and product characteristic details.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify product characteristic and, or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the business process.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify common product characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment indicating characteristic value being physical measurement (including measurable quantities and percentages) related to specified product characteristics (for example voltage, percentage of material contained) and where relevant measurement ranges.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments specifying the terms of payment applicable for the line item. This may be used by a central buyer purchasing on behalf of different item consignee combinations.

segment.name: Payment terms
segment.documentation: PYT, A segment identifying the payment terms and date/time basis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the specific date/time/period, if needed, of any payments, discounts, instalments etc.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the discount, interest, penalty as well as instalment percentage.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to payment discounts, penalties or instalments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A segment group to give information about adjustment.

segment.name: Adjustment details
segment.documentation: AJT, A segment giving adjustment details.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment giving additional information on the adjustment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments identifying the relevant pricing information for the goods or services ordered.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment to specify the price type and amount. The price used in the calculation of the line amount will be identified as 'Unit Price'.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to allow to specify the price in a different currency that in segment group 7.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to identify pricing information such as a price multiplier, the class or type of trade and additionally identifying the reason for any changes.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify the ranges(quantity, amount, etc) to which the additional price information applies.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to identify the date/time/period information related to the price change. e.g. period of validity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the line item.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 33: A group of segments identifying the packaging, physical dimensions, and marks and numbers for goods referenced in the line item.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number of packages and the physical type of packaging for the line item, e.g. pallet type.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment. e.g. cube or gross weight.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment specifying the maximum quantity number of packages which can be stacked safely on each other and/or the number of items normally contained within the package.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate the validity period in relation to the specified article.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 34: A group of segments giving references e.g. to a packing instruction document relevant to a particular package type and its date/time/period of issue.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the packing instruction document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the referenced document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 35: A group of segments specifying the markings and labels on individual physical units.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the master label number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates relevant to the package markings.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment identifying the number or ranges of numbers for use with the package markings.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 36: A group of segments specifying destination and quantity details for consignments involving multi destination deliveries.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which part of the consignment is to be delivered.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the percentage of the quantity to be delivered to the identified location.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates and/or times that the delivery should be made.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 37: A group of segments specifying quantity details and related status information of consignments involving multi destination deliveries.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment specifying the quantity to be delivered to the identified location.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment specifying the status of the quantity, including its category and the reason(s) for the status.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 38: A group of segments specifying tax related information, and when necessary, the location(s) to which that tax information relates.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate, or exemption, relating to the line item.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which the tax or exemption specified in the TAX segment applies, e.g. city or state tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 39: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information, relevant to the line item only.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the order. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified. e.g. The Buyer and Seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required, but the Consignee or Delivery address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment e.g. internal site/building number.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution (e.g. bank) and relevant account numbers for the seller, buyer and where necessary other parties e.g. the buyer may provide a choice of financial institutions for direct debit purposes.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 40: A group of segments giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the line item.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 41: A group of segments identifying the documentary requirements of the specified party.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying and providing information relating to the documents required by the party specified by the NAD segment. For example, the party may require a Certificate of Analysis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time of the document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 42: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 43: A group of segments specifying quantity details and related status information of consignments involving multi destination party deliveries.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment specifying the quantity to be delivered to the related party.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates and/or times that the delivery should be made.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment specifying the status of the quantity, including its category and the reason(s) for the status.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 44: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the line item where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to identify the date/time/period information related to the allowance or charge, e.g. period of validity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 45: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified, e.g. an allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 46: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 47: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified, e.g. an allowance of 5000 BEF may be specified if goods value ordered is greater than 100000 BEF.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 48: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 49: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the tax amount for the allowance or charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 50: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the line item, where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods item being ordered, where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 51: A group of segments giving the location and date/time information relative to the transportation.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport specified in the TDT segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date/time details of departure and/or arrival of the transported goods for the specified location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 52: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the line item where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms to be used.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms specified in the TOD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 53: A group of segments providing information relating to equipment identification and ownership, handling and notification of hazardous materials, relating to the line item where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segment.name: Equipment details
segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to define fixed information regarding equipment to be used in conjunction with the ordered item, and if required, to indicate responsibility for supply of the equipment, e.g. a container identification.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling of materials and additionally, if required, identifying hazardous materials in the ordered item.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment providing measurement information for the equipment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to give further clarification, when required, to the equipment and handling details. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 54: A group of segments specifying requested delivery schedules relating to quantities, frequencies, and dates, required for the line item, where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, A segment specifying the type and status of the schedule being given, and optionally defining a pattern to be established, e.g. firm or proposed delivery schedule for a weekly pattern.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for specifying references relevant to a schedule.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 55: A group of segments to specify the scheduled quantities, date/time details of the schedule and where required the reference of the schedule.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities relating to the schedule and pattern established in the SCC segment, e.g. delivery quantity.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time details relating to the quantity and schedule details in the SCC/QTY segments. This segment may be repeated to indicate date/time ranges, e.g. start and end dates for a delivery pattern, or delivery window.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 56: A group of segments identifying any rules, laws or regulations with which the supplier must comply to meet requirements. e.g. building regulations, safety requirements, etc.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to enable industry or national requirements to be specified.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and, where appropriate, a line number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time details relating to the references.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 57: A group of segments indicating information (quantity and amount) for the calculation of the amortization.

segment.name: Stages
segment.documentation: STG, A segment providing information related to the kind of stage in a process, the total number of stages and the current stage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 58: A group of segments indicating quantity and monetary amount related to STG.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment giving information on quantity relating to STG.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving information on monetary amount relating to STG.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 59: A group of segments that refers through an external file identification to each of the external files and giving additional information about each of the files.

segment.name: External file link identification
segment.documentation: EFI, This segment will identify the external files by indicating the file name, file number and its sequence number in an exchange.

segment.name: Computer environment details
segment.documentation: CED, To give precise definitions of all necessary elements belonging to the configuration of a computer system, e.g. hardware, firmware, operating system, communication and application software.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment giving reference related to the file identified by a previous external file link identification segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, This segment will convey the date/time details of the external file.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation:
QTY, The size/volume of the external file identified in the previous external file link identification segment.
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the summary section to avoid segment collision.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the total amounts for the whole order response message.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by the sender for checking by the receiver.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 60: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges summary totals for the order response.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance type to be summarised.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the summary amount for the allowance or charge.
